poem:
Title: "The Stunted Olive Branch"

Pitiless war, again—
a ceaseless fount,
where life fades crimson
and death toll mounts.

Arriving in Cairo,
under gauzed moonlight,
a delegation carries
hopes wrapped tight.

In austere chambers,
voices undulate,
their words are seeds,
sown in a fragile slate.

A hushed prayer,
for peace to bloom,
amidst the remnants
of targeted gloom.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Middle East crisis live: Hamas delegation in Cairo to hold ceasefire talks; Gaza death toll reaches 30,410 8.49am GMT Hamas delegation arrives in Cairo for Gaza ceasefire talks As we mentioned in our opening summary, Reuters has reported that a Hamas delegation has arrived in Cairo to hold sensitive ceasefire talks on Gaza. The delegation is being led by Hamas’ deputy chief in Gaza, Khalil Al-Hayya, a senior official told the outlet. A Palestinian official". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
